data.benefits: Scheme provides the subsidy of 50% of project cost of up to Rs.500 lakhs to facilitate setting up of R&D Centres/Laboratories.
data.eligibility: All existing units wants to set up R&D center anywhere in state are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
The unit should have Udyam certificate and Haryana udyam memorandum. 

The center must have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. 

The center must be operational at the time of disbursement. 

The R&D center must be recognized by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, Govt. of India.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units wants to set up R&D center anywhere in state are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
The unit should have Udyam certificate and Haryana udyam memorandum. 

The center must have obtained No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. 

The center must be operational at the time of disbursement. 

The R&D center must be recognized by the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research, Govt. of India.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: In supersession of the Enterprises Promotion Policy, 2015, the Governor of Haryana notified the ‘Haryana Enterprises & Employment Policy-2020’  as Annexure-‘A’, which is effective from 01st January, 2021.
data.objective: To support and motivate research and development (R&D) activities for  creating new products or technology, enhancing existing products, improving designs and quality & in order to focus on making things better or boosting the quality and reliability of products, processes, software, techniques, formulas, or inventions that a company sells, leases, or licenses.
data.description:
Scheme provides financial assistance at 50% of the project cost.
The cost of building is subject to a maximum of 25% of the project cost.
Assistance covers machinery and equipment costs up to Rs.500 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply:
Application on prescribed Form (Annexure-I) along with listed documents would be submitted to the Director/ Director General of MSMEs on the web portal of the department. 
Annexure-I: https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s3f48c04ffab49ff0e5d1176244fdfb65c/uploads/2022/06/2022060241.pdf
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned auhtority.
data.additional_info:
Link of list of Restrictive Industries in Haryana: https://www.hsiidc.org.in/uploads/estate_managements/170097742718HEEP%20restrictive%20list.pdf
Categorization of Blocks : https://investharyana.in/content/pdfs/Re-categorization%20of%20blocks%2015.11.2018.pdf
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM)
NOC/CLU (No Objection Certificate/Change of Land Use)
Haryana Resident Certificate (for local employment benefits)
ESI/PF Registration Number
Proof of Commercial Production
Financial Statements (Balance Sheet, Profit & Loss Statement)
Import-Exporter Code (IEC)
Registration-cum-Membership Certificate (RCMC) from Export Promotion Council
Land Documents (ownership or lease agreement)
Environmental Clearances (if applicable)
Zero Defect Zero Effect (ZED) Certification
Proof of Investment (in machinery/equipment)
Electricity Bills (for electricity-related incentives)
Energy Audit Report (for energy efficiency claims)
Other Miscellaneous Documents (as per specific schemes)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address :  Sh. Deepak Burak , Directorate of MSME
Phone No: 8699888828
Email-id deepakbura.etd@hry.gov.in
data.beneficiary: All Industry - All Entities - Haryana - All MSMEs
